Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2008 11:11PM sameasalways wrote: Hi everyone, I really appreciate your feedback I have never dealt with any of these issues before.  I keep hoping and telling myself it is a pappilloma or warty growth in the milk duct that is benign but it never really stops the worry or nervousness about this time frame I am dealing with.  Everyone tells me not to borrow trouble well actually I only told one person so far about what is happenning.  So I appreciate your help  very much.
Posts.Title: 3 months to be seen? sameasalways sameasalways

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2009 10:32PM sameasalways wrote: My mom is only 51 and her Mom doesn't have breast cancer nor my mom's sisters that we know of but you have to understand my family is very dysfunctional ( my mothers). My mom had some sort of cyst removed that turned out benign with an excisional biopsy.  Her one sister has MS, and the other died of Wernicke/Korsakoff's related problems.  I have a close relationship with my mother but I'm living on the opposite side of the US from her. Most of her siblings are addicted to drugs or alcohol and would not be seeing a doctor to begin with unless something horrible happenned.    Also they do not communicate with eachother very well.  My grandmothers sister one of them atleast, had her breasts removed but I don't know which one or if more than one did.  Probably the one that was a nurse! (some of the 13 siblings managed to survive).  LOL!  I have no sisters.  My dad's only sister has many fibrocystic bumps, ect , but so do I.  I guess no matter what I will be happier getting a mammogram done because I have so many lumps honestly I can't tell when to see a Dr or not.  Of course if anything strange happenned I would (as I have for the nipple bleeding).    My dad's mother died of lung cancer around age 65-67.  They all would only go to the doctor if something was wrong, if My grandmother had a lump I don't know if she would even know to go check to begin with at the time.  It was the late 80's and she never learned to drive.     I am probably in an HMO..its tricare and yes you have to have a referral by your PCM (PCP) to be seen anywhere other than on the base.  I will call them tomarrow and ask to schedue an appointment or put a T-con in with her.  If she is willing to work with me I am sure she would have no problem with ordering the ultrasound as well?  Considering the circumstances I mean?  Well I will ask them.  I hate to go in there.   Well take care and thanks everyone
Posts.Title: 3 months to be seen? sameasalways sameasalways

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2008 05:43PM sameasalways wrote: should I call the Oncology center and ask them if they want me to have an ultrasound too?  Before my appointment?  I have had nothing done yet...but by the time I get there in february it will have been 3 months since the discharge started.  The problem here is that my husband is in the military so we have Tricare insurance.  The Oncology center i am being sent to is not familiar with this.  I talked to them on the phone, they had no idea I would have to wait this long to get a mammogram and a referral for one.  They said their patients normally are seen "next door" and then they read the results on their computer  soon after.    The receptionist is trying to work with the Dr. to see if she wants me to come in sooner than Feb. 10 without the ultrasound.  I just wondered if they would want to schedule an ultrasound ahead of time  or not.  Thank you so much I don't know if I am overreacting to this time issue.   I'm sorry about your diagnosiis and hope everything goes well for you.
Posts.Title: 3 months to be seen? sameasalways sameasalways
